Subjective: Hard stools, difficult passage, 2-3 days without bowel movement, x3 months. Abdominal cramps, painful on pressure, bloated abdomen. Impact: Discomfort. Eats little, low appetite (long-standing), no change in last 3 months. Underweight, no recent weight loss. No blood in stool. Urination normal. Periods regular. Sister has ulcerative colitis, but patient denies similar symptoms. Tried olive oil, softened stool but not permanent. No smoking/alcohol mentioned. Request: Concerned if serious, wants to soften stool, wants help with underweight.
Objective: Abdomen: Normal bowel sounds. Varying tympani, dampening in lower left quadrant. Painful on pressure, sensitive in lower left quadrant. No pain in renal lodges, upper abdomen, or lower right quadrant.
Assessment: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) with constipation predominance. No alarm bells for serious conditions. Ulcerative colitis ruled out.
Plan: Explanation: IBS likely, focus on stool softening.
Medication: Psyllium fiber sachets, daily with plenty of water, for 6 weeks.
Safety net: Return if abdominal pain worsens, fever, or significant blood in stool.
Discuss dietitian referral at next visit.
